Params: A long, long time ago, or in the distant future...?
Anyway, in an ancient forest, lived a tiny wolf pup.
Born with a distinct smell and fur of a different color, she was the runt abandoned by her pack. She longed to grow strong and be accepted by others.
Heard of a treasure at the edge of the forest that would give power and a race that accepted outsiders, she headed into the depths of the forest...
What awaited her there... was not a race welcoming her with open arms. It was monsters with petrifying shapes.
The wolf pup fought with all her strength but still ended up collapsing from fatigue by the swamp deep inside the forest.
She was gravely wounded, and could only stare at the stars in the night sky as she felt warmth gradually fading from her body.
...Is this where the wolf pup's journey would end?
Right at that moment, the pup noticed a spaceship next to the swamp. She clambered into the ship and pressed some buttons.
The green button cured her wounds. The blue button gave her new powers...
Wait, wait, wait. A spaceship? Do you even know where this is going...
A good story should catch the reader off-guard. I learned this at WGAA. You really know nothing, do you?
You were the one who asked for feedback. Anyway, go on. What happens next?
No. 21 lowers her head and pokes at her terminal to turn the page.
And then the wolf pup pressed the red button.
The vessel shot off into space and the pup fainted from the extreme acceleration.
When she woke up, she found herself on an unfamiliar purple planet, with countless monsters gathered around it.
Oh! Time for a fight? This is getting interesting. How about we let Noctis enter in a glorious flash and beat those... Hey! Get your claws off me! Off!
Anyway, from here, the wolf pup begins her journey to find the treasure.
What do you mean what... We didn't even get any action! And it's over?
You're just too dumb to appreciate it.
Am not! Even a dumbass will tell you how absurd the plot is... Vera, what say you?
Hey! What's up with the change in attitude?
Come up with something worthwhile if you're gonna do it. You think I've got time to play these games with you?
I went out of my way to borrow this from WGAA only because you said you wanted to write a fairy tale. I didn't know you'd need a commandant clearance to get it. How annoying.
So you gave her this? What exactly is this thing, though?
Captain gave this to me to support my creativity.
No. 21 proudly shows off the square device in her hand.
This "Creative Device" will visually project any story input... or something like that. WGAA had something similar, right? This is just a prototype.
That sounds useful, but this... thing that she wrote doesn't even make any sense. Can it actually be visualized...?
But I guess we have no choice. If we let this go on, she'll go through our entire paper reserve.
Noctis holds up a stack of crumbled pages, each ripped and taped back together and covered in tiny scribbles of almost illegible letters and symbols.
Hahaha. Even the Autonomous Cleaners thought these were trash.
No. 21 lets out a deep growl and pounces onto Noctis' head, waving her claws.
Hey! Get off me, right now!
This is what you get for putting them into the trash can.
How would I know these aren't trash?! Do you know how long it took me to piece them all back together? My eyes were this close to popping out!
...Fine. I'll let you have one of my electrolyte drinks.
Huh? All that back-breaking work for one?
I need at least a week's worth.
Noctis is acting all self-righteous again.
...So that was the fairy tale you wanted to write?
Vera completely ignores their squabbles and looks at No. 21's terminal with crossed arms.
No. 21 takes out her terminal that's showing the words "No. 21's Creative Portfolio".
The Gray Raven Commandant helped me with inspiration. It was very helpful.
I saw... lots of ideas all in different colors.
Writing a story... If I were you, I'd start by thinking about the message I want to get across. What I want to show or tell the reader, that is...
But you can also keep it simple. Creativity should be free. Just create the colors you like with your writing.
If you don't know where to start, try building your story upon something you saw or from your own experience.
What kind of stories do I like? What a weird question. Do I look like I have nothing to do? Gosh...
But if you insist... It's got to have calamity followed by a glorious rebirth, unwavering determination, and even better if it's touching... What's that face?! Bianca loves these too!
Stories like this... are quite rare nowadays. I used to love a story about a tiny protagonist traveling between different planets.
I've sent you the data. I hope it helps.
Items from Earth have been checked and processed. Please review the item list.
A bottle of sand, a purple plant sample, "blue glass," "red rock"... and uh... half a piece of cake? Are you going to eat it, or...? A source of inspiration? I don't quite get it, but best of luck.
...(Whispering) Why is she making that face?! Am I in trouble?
...So I know what I'm going to write now.
That was just the beginning. I'm going to bring you up to speed on the rest now.
